alert.note: Alert for Cascade; Central and Southern Lewis and Clark; Chouteau; Eastern Teton (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 10:18PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions OF southeastern Teton, western Chouteau and northern Cascade Counties through 1100 PM MDT... At 1016 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fairfield to 8 miles west of Cascade. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Cascade, Fairfield, Black Eagle, Fort Shaw, Fort Shaw, Power, Portage, Eden, Malmstrom Afb, Stockett, Tracy, Vaughn, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park, Centerville, Sun River, Tower Rock State Park, Ulm, Sand Coulee and Simms. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Cascade; Central and Southern Lewis and Clark; Chouteau; Eastern Teton
